text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ImagingSelection NDomainResourceA selection of DICOM SOP instances
+ Rule: At least one of seriesUid or imageRegion3D SHALL be present
+ Rule: seriesUid SHALL only be present if studyUid is present
+ Rule: seriesNumber SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
+ Rule: instance SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
+ Rule: imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if frameOfReferenceUid is present
+ Rule: imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if instance.imageRegion2D is not present
+ Rule: if present, instance.imageRegion2D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2
+ Rule: if present, imageRegion3D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 3
+ Rule: modality SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
+ Rule: only one of instance.frameNumber, instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier, instance.segmentNumber, instance.regionOfInterest and instance.waveFormChannel SHALL be present
+ Rule: if present, instance.waveFormChannel SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2

Elements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension
identifier Σ0..*IdentifierBusiness identifier for imaging selection

status ?!Σ1..1codeavailable | entered-in-error | inactive | unknown
Binding: Imaging Selection Status (Required)
category Σ0..*CodeableConceptClassifies the imaging selection
Binding: KeyObjectSelectionDocumentTitle (Preferred)

modality ΣC0..1CodeableConceptThe distinct modality
Binding: Modality (Extensible)
code Σ1..1CodeableConceptImaging Selection purpose text or code
Binding: Image Reference Type (Preferred)
subject Σ0..1Reference(Patient | Group | Device | Procedure | Practitioner | Medication | Substance | Specimen)Who or what is the subject of the imaging selection
issued Σ0..1instantWhen the imaging selection was created
performer Σ0..*BackboneElementWho performed imaging selection and what they did

function Σ0..1CodeableConceptType of performance
Binding: ImagingStudy series performer function (Extensible)
actor Σ1..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Device | Organization | CareTeam | Patient | RelatedPerson | HealthcareService)Who performed the imaging selection
basedOn Σ0..*Reference(CarePlan | ServiceRequest | Appointment | Task)Fulfills plan or order

derivedFrom Σ0..1Reference(ImagingStudy | DocumentReference)The imaging study from which the imaging selection is derived
studyUid ΣC0..1idDICOM Study Instance UID
seriesUid ΣC0..1idDICOM Series Instance UID
seriesNumber ΣC0..1unsignedIntNumeric identifier of the selected series
frameOfReferenceUid ΣC0..1idThe Frame of Reference UID for the selected images
bodySite Σ0..*CodeableReference(BodyStructure)Selected anatomic structure
Binding: SNOMED CT Body Structures (Example)

focus Σ0..*Reference(ImagingSelection)Related resources that are the focus for the imaging selection

endpoint Σ0..*Reference(Endpoint)The network services providing access for the subset of the study

instance ΣC0..*BackboneElementThe selected instances

uid Σ1..1idDICOM SOP Instance UID
number Σ0..1unsignedIntThe number of this instance in the series
sopClass 0..1oidDICOM class type
frameNumber C0..*positiveIntSelected frames

referencedContentItemIdentifier C0..*positiveIntSelected content items

segmentNumber C0..*positiveIntSelected segments

regionOfInterest C0..*positiveIntSelected regions of interest

waveFormChannel C0..*positiveIntSelected waveform channel

imageRegion2D C0..*BackboneElementA 2D region in an image

regionType 1..1codepoint | polyline | multipoint | circle | ellipse
Binding: Imaging Selection 2D Graphic Type (Required)
coordinate C1..*decimalThe coordinates that define the image region
This repeating element order: The values are an ordered set of (x, y) coordinates.
imageRegion3D C0..*BackboneElementA 3D region in a DICOM frame of reference

regionType 1..1codepoint | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid
Binding: Imaging Selection 3D Graphic Type (Required)
coordinate C1..*decimalSpecifies the coordinates that define the image region
This repeating element order: The values are an ordered set of (x, y, z) coordinates.

Documentation for this format

name: ImagingSelection
description: A selection of DICOM SOP instances within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as a set of frames or an image region, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource.

element.short: A selection of DICOM SOP instances
element.definition: A selection of DICOM SOP instances within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as a set of frames or an image region, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id.trace('id') in %resource.descendants().select(reference | as(uri))) or descendants().where(reference='#' | as(uri)='#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
At least one of seriesUid or imageRegion3D SHALL be present
seriesUid SHALL only be present if studyUid is present
seriesNumber SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
instance SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if frameOfReferenceUid is present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if instance.imageRegion2D is not present
if present, instance.imageRegion2D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2
if present, imageRegion3D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 3
modality SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
only one of instance.frameNumber, instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier, instance.segmentNumber, instance.regionOfInterest and instance.waveFormChannel SHALL be present
constraint.expression: (instance.frameNumber.exists() implies (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.segmentNumber.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.regionOfInterest.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.waveFormChannel.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists()).not())

constraint.human: if present, instance.waveFormChannel SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: Within the context of the FHIR RESTful interactions, the resource has an id except for cases like the create and conditional update. Otherwise, the use of the resouce id depends on the given use case.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc. For DomainResources, if more than one implicitRules policy applies, additional policies may be conveyed using the [additionalImplicitRules](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-extensions/StructureDefinition-additionalImplicitRules.html) extension.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of its narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies its meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: IETF language tag for a human language

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags in their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels. Contained resources may be a resource type defined in the FHIR specification, or an [additional resource](resource.html#additional).

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this imaging selection by the performer and/or other systems.  These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices MAY occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the imaging selection as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The current state of the imaging selection. This is distinct from the status of any imaging study, service request, or task associated with the imaging selection.
element.comment: Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource SHOULD NOT be treated as valid

element.definition: Classifies the general purpose of the imaging selection.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what imaging selections are retrieved and displayed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The distinct modality for this selected series. This MAY be either an acquisition modality (e.g. CT, MR) or a non-acquisition modality (e.g. segmentation, presentation state).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance.

element.short: Imaging Selection purpose text or code
element.definition: Identifies the type of imaging selection.
element.requirements: Identifies the type of content and the structure of the imaging selection.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who or what is the subject of the imaging selection
element.definition: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging selection.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Patient ID (0010,0020) and Issuer of Patient ID (0010,0021) and / or Issuer of Patient ID Qualifiers Sequence (0010,0024) and / or Patient Name (0010,0010)

element.short: When the imaging selection was created
element.definition: Date and time the imaging selection was created.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who performed imaging selection and what they did
element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection and how they were involved.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

mapping.map: One or more of: Performing Physician's Name (0008,1050) and Performing Physician Identification Sequence (0008,1052); Operators' Name (0008,1070) and Operator Identification Sequence (0008,1072); Manufacturer (0008,0070) and Manufacturer's Model Name (0008,1090); or Institution Name (0008,0080)

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the imaging selection.
element.requirements: Allows disambiguation of the types of involvement of different performers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The type of involvement of the performer.

mapping.map: PRF (Performing Physician's Name); SPRF (Operator's Name); DEV (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or LOC (Institution Name)

element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Practitioner (Performing Physician's Name); Practitioner (Operator's Name); Device (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or Organization (Institution Name)

element.definition: A plan or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this imaging selection.
element.requirements: Allows tracing of authorization for the imaging selection and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon. If the imaging selection is associated with an Accession Number, this field SHOULD include a reference to that value in the form: identifier.value = (Accession Number Value) identifier.type = ACSN. A reference value pointing to a ServiceRequest resource is allowed but is not required.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Accession Number (0080,0050) and Issuer of Accession Number Sequence (0080,0051)

element.short: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is derived
element.definition: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is made.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The Study Instance UID for the DICOM Study from which the images were selected.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.2](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.2.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The DICOM Series Instance UID of the selected series.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.3](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.3.html).
element.requirements: Must correspond to a Series that is part of the DICOM study identified by the `studyUid` element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Numeric identifier of the selected series
element.definition: The numeric identifier of the selected series in the study.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.3](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.3.html).
element.requirements: Must correspond to the series identified by the `seriesUid` element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The Frame of Reference UID for the selected images
element.definition: Identifier used to group composite instances that have the same coordinate system that conveys spatial and/or temporal information.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.4.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.4.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The anatomic structures selected. See [DICOM Part 16 Annex L](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite MAY include the laterality of body part imaged.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueMarkdown: Codes describing anatomical locations. MAY include laterality.

mapping.map: Body Part Examined (0018,0015) or Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) and Laterality (0020,0060)

element.short: Related resources that are the focus for the imaging selection
element.definition: The actual focus of an imaging selection when it is another imaging selection resource and not the patient of record.
element.comment:
An imaging selection MAY reference a DICOM resource that itself references other DICOM resources.
       e.g. a presentation state references a set of source images or frames.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The network services providing access for the subset of the study
element.definition: The network services providing access to the selected images, frames, etc. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.
element.requirements: If this element is not present and ImagingSelection.seriesUid is present, all instances in the specified series are included in the selection.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition:

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: The SOP Instance UID for the selected DICOM this image or other DICOM content.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.12.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.12.html).
element.requirements:
DICOM SOP Instance UID.
Must correspond to a SOP Instance that is part of the DICOM series identified by the `seriesUID` element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The number of this instance in the series
element.definition: TThe number of the instance assigned by the creator of the series. MAY or MAY NOT correspond to intended display order.
element.comment:
See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.6.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.6.html#sect_C.7.6.1).
       Note: A multiframe instance has a single instance number with each frame identified by a frame number.
element.requirements:
DICOM Instance Number.
Must correspond to the SOP Instance identified by the `uid` element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: DICOM instance type.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.12.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.12.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table 10.3](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_10.3.html#table_10-3)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a multiframe SOP Class.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A list of Referenced Content Item Identifier values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.17.3.2.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.17.3.2.5.html)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Class.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table C.8.20-4](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.20.4.html#table_C.8.20-4)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a segmentation SOP Class.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.8.5.html)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a radiotherapy structure set SOP Class.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition:
A list of channels in a Waveform selected from an instance of a waveform SOP Class.
Each channel is specified as a pair of values where the first value is the Multiplex Group Number, and the second value is the Channel Number within the multiplex group (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.5.1.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.5.html#sect_C.18.5.1.1)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a waveform  structure set SOP Class.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Specifies an image region, defined by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates in pixel space.
element.requirements: SHALL NOT be present if the parent imagingSelection.instance is not an image. If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: The type of image region.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.10.5.1.2](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.10.5.html#sect_C.10.5.1.2).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The coordinates that define the image region
element.definition:
The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution.
The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values SHALL be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.
element.comment: For a description of how 2D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.6](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.6.html).
element.requirements: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of two.
element.orderMeaning: The values are an ordered set of (x, y) coordinates.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A 3D region in a DICOM frame of reference
element.definition: Specifies a 3D image region, defined by a region type and a set of 3D coordinates.
element.requirements: The referenced 3D image region must be in the coordinate system identified by the `frameOfReferenceUid` element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children or both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: point | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid
element.definition: Specifies the type of image region.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.18.9.1.2](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.9.html#sect_C.18.9.1.2).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition: The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as an ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and MAY be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by ImagingSelection.frameOfReferenceUid element.
element.comment: For a description of how 3D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS3.3 C.18.9](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.9.html).
element.requirements: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of three.
element.orderMeaning: The values are an ordered set of (x, y, z) coordinates.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A selection of DICOM SOP instances
element.definition: A selection of DICOM SOP instances within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as a set of frames or an image region, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource.

constraint.human: if present, imageRegion3D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 3
if present, instance.imageRegion2D.coordinate SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2
modality SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
instance SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
seriesNumber SHALL only be present if seriesUid is present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if instance.imageRegion2D is not present
imageRegion3D SHALL only be present if frameOfReferenceUid is present
if present, instance.waveFormChannel SHALL have a value count that is a multiple of 2
only one of instance.frameNumber, instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier, instance.segmentNumber, instance.regionOfInterest and instance.waveFormChannel SHALL be present
constraint.expression: (instance.frameNumber.exists() implies (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.segmentNumber.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.regionOfInterest.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.waveFormChannel.exists()).not()) and (instance.waveFormChannel.exists() implies (instance.frameNumber.exists() or instance.referencedContentItemIdentifier.exists() or instance.segmentNumber.exists() or instance.regionOfInterest.exists()).not())

constraint.human: seriesUid SHALL only be present if studyUid is present
At least one of seriesUid or imageRegion3D SHALL be present

element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this imaging selection by the performer and/or other systems.  These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices MAY occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the imaging selection as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

element.definition: The current state of the imaging selection. This is distinct from the status of any imaging study, service request, or task associated with the imaging selection.
element.comment: Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource SHOULD NOT be treated as valid

element.definition: Classifies the general purpose of the imaging selection.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what imaging selections are retrieved and displayed.

element.definition: The distinct modality for this selected series. This MAY be either an acquisition modality (e.g. CT, MR) or a non-acquisition modality (e.g. segmentation, presentation state).

binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance.

element.short: Imaging Selection purpose text or code
element.definition: Identifies the type of imaging selection.
element.requirements: Identifies the type of content and the structure of the imaging selection.

element.short: Who or what is the subject of the imaging selection
element.definition: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging selection.

mapping.map: Patient ID (0010,0020) and Issuer of Patient ID (0010,0021) and / or Issuer of Patient ID Qualifiers Sequence (0010,0024) and / or Patient Name (0010,0010)

element.short: When the imaging selection was created
element.definition: Date and time the imaging selection was created.

element.short: Who performed imaging selection and what they did
element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection and how they were involved.

mapping.map: One or more of: Performing Physician's Name (0008,1050) and Performing Physician Identification Sequence (0008,1052); Operators' Name (0008,1070) and Operator Identification Sequence (0008,1072); Manufacturer (0008,0070) and Manufacturer's Model Name (0008,1090); or Institution Name (0008,0080)

element.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the imaging selection.
element.requirements: Allows disambiguation of the types of involvement of different performers.

binding.description: The type of involvement of the performer.

mapping.map: PRF (Performing Physician's Name); SPRF (Operator's Name); DEV (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or LOC (Institution Name)

element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the imaging selection.

mapping.map: Practitioner (Performing Physician's Name); Practitioner (Operator's Name); Device (Manufacturer / Manufacturer's Model Name); or Organization (Institution Name)

element.definition: A plan or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this imaging selection.
element.requirements: Allows tracing of authorization for the imaging selection and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon. If the imaging selection is associated with an Accession Number, this field SHOULD include a reference to that value in the form: identifier.value = (Accession Number Value) identifier.type = ACSN. A reference value pointing to a ServiceRequest resource is allowed but is not required.

mapping.map: Accession Number (0080,0050) and Issuer of Accession Number Sequence (0080,0051)

element.short: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is derived
element.definition: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is made.
The Study Instance UID for the DICOM Study from which the images were selected.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.2](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.2.html).

element.definition: The DICOM Series Instance UID of the selected series.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.3](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.3.html).
element.requirements: Must correspond to a Series that is part of the DICOM study identified by the `studyUid` element.

element.short: Numeric identifier of the selected series
element.definition: The numeric identifier of the selected series in the study.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.3](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.3.html).
element.requirements: Must correspond to the series identified by the `seriesUid` element.

element.short: The Frame of Reference UID for the selected images
element.definition: Identifier used to group composite instances that have the same coordinate system that conveys spatial and/or temporal information.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.4.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.4.html).

element.definition: The anatomic structures selected. See [DICOM Part 16 Annex L](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite MAY include the laterality of body part imaged.

extension.valueMarkdown: Codes describing anatomical locations. MAY include laterality.

mapping.map: Body Part Examined (0018,0015) or Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) and Laterality (0020,0060)

element.short: Related resources that are the focus for the imaging selection
element.definition: The actual focus of an imaging selection when it is another imaging selection resource and not the patient of record.
element.comment:
An imaging selection MAY reference a DICOM resource that itself references other DICOM resources.
       e.g. a presentation state references a set of source images or frames.

element.short: The network services providing access for the subset of the study
element.definition: The network services providing access to the selected images, frames, etc. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints.
Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.
element.requirements: If this element is not present and ImagingSelection.seriesUid is present, all instances in the specified series are included in the selection.

element.definition: The SOP Instance UID for the selected DICOM this image or other DICOM content.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.12.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.12.html).
element.requirements:
DICOM SOP Instance UID.
Must correspond to a SOP Instance that is part of the DICOM series identified by the `seriesUID` element.

element.short: The number of this instance in the series
element.definition: TThe number of the instance assigned by the creator of the series. MAY or MAY NOT correspond to intended display order.
element.comment:
See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.6.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.6.html#sect_C.7.6.1).
       Note: A multiframe instance has a single instance number with each frame identified by a frame number.
element.requirements:
DICOM Instance Number.
Must correspond to the SOP Instance identified by the `uid` element.

element.definition: DICOM instance type.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.12.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.12.html).

element.definition: A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table 10.3](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_10.3.html#table_10-3)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a multiframe SOP Class.

element.definition: A list of Referenced Content Item Identifier values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.17.3.2.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.17.3.2.5.html)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Class.

element.definition: A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 Table C.8.20-4](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.20.4.html#table_C.8.20-4)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a segmentation SOP Class.

element.definition: A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.8.8.5](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.8.8.5.html)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a radiotherapy structure set SOP Class.

element.definition:
A list of channels in a Waveform selected from an instance of a waveform SOP Class.
Each channel is specified as a pair of values where the first value is the Multiplex Group Number, and the second value is the Channel Number within the multiplex group (See [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.5.1.1](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.5.html#sect_C.18.5.1.1)).
element.requirements: Only allowed if the value of `instance.sopClass` corresponds to a waveform  structure set SOP Class.

element.definition: Specifies an image region, defined by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates in pixel space.
element.requirements: SHALL NOT be present if the parent imagingSelection.instance is not an image. If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.

element.definition: The type of image region.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.10.5.1.2](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.10.5.html#sect_C.10.5.1.2).

element.short: The coordinates that define the image region
element.definition:
The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution.
The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values SHALL be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.
element.comment: For a description of how 2D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS 3.3 C.18.6](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.6.html).
element.requirements: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of two.
element.orderMeaning: The values are an ordered set of (x, y) coordinates.

element.short: A 3D region in a DICOM frame of reference
element.definition: Specifies a 3D image region, defined by a region type and a set of 3D coordinates.
element.requirements: The referenced 3D image region must be in the coordinate system identified by the `frameOfReferenceUid` element

element.short: point | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid
element.definition: Specifies the type of image region.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.18.9.1.2](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.9.html#sect_C.18.9.1.2).

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition: The coordinates defining the image region. Encoded as an ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and MAY be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by ImagingSelection.frameOfReferenceUid element.
element.comment: For a description of how 3D coordinates are encoded, see [DICOM PS3.3 C.18.9](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.18.9.html).
element.requirements: The number of values SHALL be a multiple of three.
element.orderMeaning: The values are an ordered set of (x, y, z) coordinates.
